Playingwithfusion library and Robotpy Programming
Has anyone been able to get the playingwithfusion ToF device to work with robotpy this year? We’ve used them for the past two years in our python code and they have been great. However, this year we can pip install the robotpy-playingwithfusion libraries and can sim the code as usual, but we can’t seem to get a library to the rio. Putting “playingwithfusion” in the requires section or the robotpy_extras section of pyproject.toml both fail on deploy. Output of pip list -v is here. Seems lik…

API is at playingwithfusion Package — RobotPy PlayingWithFusion 2025.1.23 documentation, and usually you can ask ChatGPT to translate Java into python and it’ll get pretty close.

"},"post_url":"/t/help-using-playing-with-fusion-tof-sensor-and-python/495833/4","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3560758,"name":"CJ Hill","username":"CJ_Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T16:56:30.650Z","cooked":"

From our point of view, the python library works fine, thanks!
You’ll have to do a pip install robotpy-playingwithfusion and add it in your pyproject.toml requires section like we did here.
There is also the webpage on the rio (port 5812) where you have to set the CAN ID once the libraries are deployed to the rio.
We had to put in a bit of logic to help cancel out the lights reporting a range of zero.
At the moment we use it on our intake to detect coral, (the python git is here). We also used it in previous years to detect rings, elevator absolute location, and cubes/cones.
